snippet: The order, announced by the Cabinet, did not specify when the transfer would take place or where former President Hosni Mubarak would be moved, but it could happen as early as Thursday.
abstract: Egypt’s military-appointed government orders former Pres Hosni Mubarak transferred from prison to house arrest after court says he could no longer legally be held behind bars; Mubarak's release injects potentially volatile new element into political crisis that has been convulsing country.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: The order, announced by the Cabinet, did not specify when the transfer would take place or where former President Hosni Mubarak would be moved, but it could happen as early as Thursday.

headline.main: Mubarak to Be Transferred to House Arrest
headline.print_headline: Mubarak to Be Moved to House Arrest, Adding Volatile Facet to Egypt’s Crisis

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
